text: no my own popular opinion um I guess the
what I would go with today is that um I
think there's value in using just
something like notepad or like a basic

um with programming at least early on to

helped you learn to pay attention to
certain details and like really focus on
what's there because I noticed that with
a lot of people who are new to
programming they'll Miss small little
like typos or bugs like that that an
experienced developer like really stands
out to them and I think sometimes it's
because they're so used to writing like
like paragraphs and stuff where your
your brain can just kind of skip over
and make sense of it whereas a computer
doesn't know how to do that yeah I think
when you're learning
I think that that's
a complete yeah completely valid like
depends on what you want to focus on
right
um sure and like I say this in the sense
of I don't think most people ever do it
but like I remember I wrote Java on like
it was um
it wasn't notepad it was something
similar to that on Linux that basically
had no autocomplete or anything and Java
was awful for it at times but it
definitely helped me understand what was
in certain standard libraries and how it
worked and like the tools that I was
using for those projects I really
understood well and I like I definitely
did some bad habits of like importing an
entire in Java you could like import
like an entire star like sub package
type thing so I didn't Port way more
than I needed to but it was still
helpful it's not like I would recommend
doing it all the time but like doing it
every once in a while was a helpful tool
